page.title: 12Crop Spraying.
page.content: {Peter Scott}has his own farm in Thorpe Audlin. He is a{crop sprayer}and gave us some information about the operation. The most common crop is{wheat.} Ladybirds are useful to the crops because they eat the aphids which are the most common and most harmful pests on the farms today. The other pests are{bladder podge midge, seed weavil and the{common beetle.}Pests like these harm the crops by eating them and spreading disease. Little of the crops are taken by pests because Peter controls them, if he didn't they would {damage 50% of the crop. The sprays that Peter uses are {fungicide,insecticide and herbicide.} These sprays don't harm wildlife. Each field is sprayed{three times a {year.}The tank delivers{ten gallons to {an acre.}
